canada_cases_by_city.city: Gaspésie Îles de la Madeleine, QC

canada_case_details.detail: Alberta reported 18 new cases of COVID-19 on Monday, bringing the total number of cases to 74, including five people who have been hospitalized. The province reported one case each in the north and south health zones, which means the illness has now been found across Alberta.

Assunta Gerretsen, wife of former Kingston, Ont., mayor and MPP John Gerretsen and mother of current Kingston and the Islands MP Mark Gerretsen, says she has tested positive for the novel coronavirus. She has been in quarantine at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Trenton, Ontario since the Canadian government repatriated her, her husband and 226 other Canadian passengers from the Grand Princess cruise ship off the coast of California.

The Manitoba government has confirmed an eighth presumptive positive case of COVID-19.  The latest case, is a man in his 80s living in Winnipeg. The man, along with the other seven confirmed cases, have all been exposed to the virus through recent travel.

Three more people have died of COVID-19 in B.C. in recent days, bringing the country's total number of deaths linked to the pandemic to four.  All of the deaths stem from an outbreak at the Lynn Valley Care Centre home in North Vancouver, B.C., which first sickened a cluster of residents and staff earlier this month. 30 additional cases of COVID-19 have been confirmed in B.C. since Saturday. The new cases bring B.C.'s total to 103.

Ontario reported 32 new coronavirus cases on Monday morning, bringing the new provincial active total to 172. Among the new cases, 11 are from Toronto. Three cases in the city were believed to be instances of community transmission.
Ottawa has three new confirmed cases of the novel coronavirus. That puts the total number of cases in Ottawa up to 13 as of the morning of Monday, March 16.

York region reported 5 new coronavirus cases on Monday morning. Two are in Vaughan, one in Markham, and one in Aurora.  A woman aged in her 20s is the first case confirmed in Aurora. The case, in Markham, is a man aged in his 40s.  A woman aged in her 70s and a woman in her 60s are the two cases in Vaughan. All cases are travel related.
Peel region reported 4 new coronavirus cases today

Hamilton Public Health has confirmed five new positive tests for the novel coronavirus disease, known as COVID-19, in the city. The five new cases were all related to travel. As of Monday, Hamilton had tested 244 people for COVID-19, with 10 positive cases. Four of the 10 cases were still in the early stages of an investigation, but its believed they were all travel-related with no community transmission. Among the infected were a three-month-old child and a couple in their 60s who travelled to the Caribbean.
